snippet: Iquan Williams’s parents had set a firm curfew and no-parties rule, but the trouble forecast on Facebook ended his life.
abstract: Iquan Williams, 16, is fatally shot on his way home from a party in Brownsville, Brooklyn; killing is the sixth in New York City recorded in the first four days of 2014, and the first in Brownsville; area of eastern Brooklyn is plagued by shootings between rival groups of teenagers, more often jockeying not over drugs or money but for respect and reputation

byline.original: By ANNIE CORREAL and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: Iquan Williams’s parents had set a firm curfew and no-parties rule, but the trouble forecast on Facebook ended his life.

headline.main: 16-Year-Old Is Fatally Shot on His Way Home From a Party in Brownsville
headline.print_headline: 16-Year-Old Is Fatally Shot on His Way Home From a Party in Brownsville
